review: I delivered my sweet baby boy vaginally under the care of Dr. Sandhya Rani on 23rd July. I'm sharing my detailed experience below.We visited Dr. Sandhya Rani to confirm pregnancy as first time parents. In the first visit itself, the doctor listened to our questions patiently and explained every relevant detail very clearly. As pregnancy progressed, she was so reassuring for us that we decided and convinced our parents to deliver the baby here itself as opposed to home town.At each visit, she will listen and patiently answer to the list of questions (yes, we had a list at each visit :) ) and guide me with the diet and exercises to have a healthy pregnancy.At the end of 38th week, I noticed reduced movement but my family assured it happens occasionally.  But what was ringing in my mind is the only advice doctor gave after 36 weeks, report for any reduced fetal activity. We checked at the L&D ward and by that time, baby's movement was normal as well as the FHR. Doctor still asked for a growth scan which revealed low amniotic fluid. We were explained the pros and cons of waiting for natural contractions and decided to go with induction as baby was term already. I got admitted at the hospital on the same night for induction but labor only started next afternoon. With 5 hours of active and intense labor gave birth to my sweet baby that day.Our heartfelt gratitude to Dr. Sandhya Rani and her team who were very kind and supportive throughout my pregnancy and delivery process. Also, the nursing and support staff at Aster Whitefield are really the best and took great care of us.

review:
The best thing that has happened to us in the pandemic is Dr. Sandhya Rani.
My gastroenterologist suggested Dr. Sandhya Rani when we expressed our wish to have a second baby. We visited her 3 months prior to planning our baby for pre-pregnancy check up and to get a feel of the doctor. From day one of meeting her I had expressed my wish for VBAC and she was fully supportive of that. Guided us through the pre-pregnancy period. I was 2 months pregnant when my husband, my son and I got covid. Dr. Sandhya Ma'am listened to all our worries, guided us and became a shoulder to cry on during post covid recovery period. She shared her direct contact number and was reachable on WhatsApp through out. Suggested diet modifications, exercises. Though in anomaly scan showed low lying placenta, Dr. was optimistic and cheered me up to keep my spirits up. However the placenta did not move up. Though I couldn't fulfill my dream for a VBAC and had to undergo elective c sec due to placenta previa, I was given a respectful and dignified birthing experience by Dr. Sandhya Rani and team. This is an experience that I'll take to my grave.
Doctor is very empathetic, kind human being who sees her patients with utmost respect and values their feelings. It was my request to have skin to skin, delayed cord clamping, and golden hour breastfeeding. All of these wishes got fulfilled only because of Dr.
A respectful and dignified birthing experience is a right of every woman. I was denied that in my first delivery at my home town. But I'm forever grateful to God for bringing Dr. Sandhya Rani to my life. Dr gave me the best birthing experience. She is a blessing.
